summary: This is the curriculum vitae of Dr. Kimberly B. Mehlman-Orozco, a criminologist and human trafficking expert. It details her academic background, publications, presentations, and expert witness work, including a notable citation regarding Jeffrey Epstein's plea deal with Alexander Acosta. The CV establishes her as a subject matter expert in human trafficking and related legal cases.

persons.name: Kimberly B. Mehlman-Orozco
persons.context: The subject of the CV; a PhD criminologist who has served as an expert witness and consultant on human trafficking cases, including commentary on the Jeffrey Epstein case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of a 2019 USA Today publication where Mehlman-Orozco commented on his non-prosecution agreement with Alexander Acosta.

persons.name: Alexander Acosta
persons.context: Referenced in a 2019 publication title regarding the plea deal he made with Jeffrey Epstein while serving as U.S. Attorney.

persons.name: Robert Kraft
persons.context: Mentioned in a 2019 publication title regarding a spa scandal and sex trafficking allegations.

persons.name: William D. Snyder
persons.context: Co-author with Mehlman-Orozco on publications related to sex trafficking and the Robert Kraft case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned in a media selection entry from July 4, 2020, regarding her arraignment in the Epstein case.

persons.name: R. Kelly
persons.context: Mentioned in a media selection entry from April 12, 2019, regarding sex allegations.

connections.description: Mehlman-Orozco provided expert commentary on Epstein's non-prosecution agreement in a USA Today publication.
Referenced in a publication title regarding the plea deal Acosta made with Epstein.
Co-authored publications on sex trafficking topics.
Maxwell is referenced in media as Epstein's alleged accomplice regarding her arraignment.

events.title: Commentary on Epstein-Acosta Deal
events.description: Mehlman-Orozco published an article in USA Today titled "Jeffrey Epstein's deal with Alexander Acosta wasn't out of line with what I have seen."

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Arraignment Coverage
events.description: CBS News covered the arraignment of Ghislaine Maxwell, Epstein's alleged accomplice, as noted in the CV's media selection.

events.title: ABC Panel on Jeffrey Epstein Case
events.description: Mehlman-Orozco participated in a panel discussion on Jeffrey Epstein on ABC's "This Week with George Stephanopoulos."

keyFacts: Dr. Kimberly B. Mehlman-Orozco is a criminologist and recognized expert on human trafficking who has served as an expert witness in numerous cases.
She authored a 2019 USA Today article commenting that Jeffrey Epstein's non-prosecution deal with Alexander Acosta "wasn't out of line" with what she had observed in her field.
Her CV lists multiple media appearances where she discussed the Epstein case, including a 2019 panel on ABC's "This Week with George Stephanopoulos."
She has provided expert testimony and consultation in federal and state cases related to human trafficking and sex crimes.
The CV establishes her professional network and expertise, positioning her as a potential resource or commentator on cases like Epstein's.
